狼井.definition: wolf trap (trou de loup), medieval defensive trap consisting of a concealed pit with sharp spikes

狼吞虎嚥.definition: to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously; to gorge oneself

狼嗥.definition: wolves howling; (fig.) to howl; to ululate

狼圖騰.definition: Wolf Totem, novel by Lü Jiamin 呂嘉民|吕嘉民[Lu:3 Jia1 min2] aka Jiang Rong 姜戎[Jiang1 Rong2]

狼多肉少.definition: many wolves and not enough meat; not enough to go around

狼奔豕突.definition: the wolf runs and the wild boar rushes (idiom); crowds of evil-doers mill around like wild beasts

狼子野心.definition: ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs

狼孩.definition: wolf child; human child raised by wolves (in legends)

狼心狗肺.definition: lit. heart of wolf and lungs of dog (idiom); cruel and unscrupulous

狼煙.definition: smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces

狼煙四起.definition: fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war

狼狽.definition: in a difficult situation; to cut a sorry figure; scoundrel! (derog.)

狼狽不堪.definition: battered and exhausted; stuck in a dilemma

狼狽為奸.definition: villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)

狼獾.definition: wolverine (Gulo gulo), also named 貂熊[diao1 xiong2]

狼藉.definition: in a mess; scattered about; in complete disorder

狼號鬼哭.definition: lit. wolves howling, devils groaning (idiom); pathetic screams

狼頭.definition: variant of 榔頭|榔头[lang2 tou5]

狼顧.definition: to look over one's shoulder constantly (like a wolf); to be fearful
